article.headline: Niagara 85, Fairfield 76
article.story: LEWISTON, N.Y. (AP) -- Charron Fisher scored 27 points to lead Niagara in an 85-76 win over Fairfield Tuesday night. Leading 37-36 at halftime, Niagara (8-8, 3-2 Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference) opened the second half with a 12-5 run. Fisher, J.R. Duffey and Tyrone Lewis all scored 3-pointers in the first three minutes to put the lead at 49-41. The Purple Eagles, who have won seven of their last nine games, made a season-high 15 3-pointers and maintained their lead over Fairfield (3-14, 1-4) by shooting 9-14 from 3-point range in the second half. The Stags trailed by double digits for most of the final eight minutes. Fairfield connected on consecutive field goals only once in the second half. Lorenzo Miles had 19 points for Niagara, Lewis finished with 18 and Duffey contributed 11. Mike Van Schaick led the Stags, losers of four-straight and seven of their last eight, with 18 points. Herbie Allen added 13 points. Fairfield fell to 0-9 on the road. The Stags entered the game with the MAACs No. 1 ranked defense but allowed a season-high 85 points.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
